byline.original: By CECILIA KANG and ERIC LICHTBLAU

abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation official Amy Hess defends agency's use of third party hackers to crack iPhone used by one of attackers in San Bernardino, Calif, terrorist attack during congressional hearing.
lead_paragraph: Government officials and Apple representatives showed no sign of compromise in their battle over encryption and privacy, as they appeared before a congressional panel.

headline.main: F.B.I. Says It Needs Hackers to Keep Up With Tech Companies
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Says It Needs Hackers to Keep Up With Tech Companies’ Encryption

snippet: Government officials and Apple representatives showed no sign of compromise in their battle over encryption and privacy, as they appeared before a congressional panel.
